title: Professional Communication Essentials
description: Master formal business communication for professional gig work interactions

vocabulary.context: Used to describe conduct and appearance
Essential quality in all customer interactions
Builds customer trust and repeat business

phrases.english: Thank you for choosing my service
Please let me know if you need anything
phrases.spanish: Por favor, avíseme si necesita algo
phrases.pronunciation: por fah-VOR, ah-VEE-seh-meh see neh-seh-SEE-tah AL-go

phrases.context: Professional apology for delays or issues

culturalNotes.note: American customers appreciate friendly professionalism - not too formal, but always respectful
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: More relaxed than traditional Colombian formal business speech

culturalNotes.note: US culture values direct, clear communication. It's okay to ask clarifying questions
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: Less indirect than typical Colombian communication style

culturalNotes.note: Americans place high value on punctuality and respecting others' time
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: Stricter time expectations than Colombian 'hora colombiana'

practicalScenarios.situation: Meeting a new customer for the first time
practicalScenarios.spanishResponse: Buenas tardes, soy [nombre]. Gracias por elegir mi servicio hoy.
practicalScenarios.englishTranslation: Good afternoon, I'm [name]. Thank you for choosing my service today.
practicalScenarios.tips: Make eye contact, smile, and speak clearly

practicalScenarios.situation: Customer asks for a special accommodation
practicalScenarios.spanishResponse: Con mucho gusto. Permítame ver qué puedo hacer por usted.
practicalScenarios.englishTranslation: With pleasure. Let me see what I can do for you.
practicalScenarios.tips: Show willingness even if you're unsure you can accommodate
